title: More than 2,000 feared dead in Libya after storm Daniel causes flooding
description: More than 2,000 people are believed to have died in devastating floods in eastern Libya, the country's military spokesman said in a press conference.

title: WATCH:  Devastating earthquake severely damages old town of Marrakech
description: The death toll has continued to climb in the wake of the rare and powerful 6.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Morocco.

title: US clears way for deal with Iran to free detained Americans
description: Secretary of State Blinken waived sanctions on $6 billion in Iranian money.

title: Cyberattack shuts down IT systems at MGM hotels in Las Vegas
description: IT systems at several major hotels along the casino strip were in the dark following a cyberattack on their computers, MGM hotel officials said.

title: American freed after being trapped in Turkish cave for 12 days
description: The American caver trapped underground in Turkey has been hoisted to safety.

title: Trump files motion to have judge in federal election interference case disqualified
description: Former President Trump has filed a motion seeking to have the judge overseeing his federal 2020 election interference case be recused and disqualified.

title: 'Stop Cop City' petition in limbo as Atlanta officials refuse to process signatures
description: Officials from the City of Atlanta have refused to verify tens of thousands of signatures submitted by activists who have been trying for two years to stop the construction of a police and firefighter training center

title: NTSB: Plane that came to rest on 1 engine suffered a broken pin inside landing gear
description: A broken pin might have caused a landing gear failure that left an Alaska Airlines jet resting on one of its engines last month

title: Ironman Wisconsin competitor dies after falling ill during bike portion triathlon
description: Authorities say a man competing in Ironman Wisconsin fell ill during the grueling triathlon and later died

title: Cybersecurity 'issue' prompts computer shutdowns at MGM Resorts properties across US
description: Casino and hotel giant MGM Resorts International says a cybersecurity issue led to the shutdown of computer systems at its properties across the U.S. A statement Monday from the Las Vegas-based company said the incident began Sunday and the extent of i...

title: JM Smucker to buy snack maker Hostess Brands for $5.6 billion
description: Hostess Brands announced a definitive agreement with The J.M. Smucker Co. for a cash and stock transaction valued at nearly $5.6 billion.

title: Trial begins over Texas voter laws that sparked 38-day walkout by Democrats in 2021
description: Trial begins over Texas voter laws that sparked 38-day walkout by Democrats.

title: FDA approves new COVID booster amid rising cases, hospitalizations
description: The Food and Drug Administration approvedd new, updated COVID boosters on Monday as cases and hospitalizations rise across the United States.

title: Ex-Bengals player Adam 'Pacman' Jones arrested at Cincinnati airport
description: Police responded to a report of an “unruly passenger” at a Cincinnati airport.

title: NBA guard Kevin Porter Jr. arrested for domestic violence: Sources
description: Houston Rockets guard Kevin Porter is under arrest in New York City Monday for allegedly assaulting his girlfriend, police sources told ABC News.

title: Mark Meadows requests emergency stay in Georgia election interference case
description: Mark Meadows has filed an emergency motion asking a judge to stay his order rejecting Meadows' request to move his Georgia election interference case to federal court.

title: Disney, Charter settle cable dispute hours before 'Monday Night Football' opener
description: The dispute had cut some 15 million cable TV customers off from ESPN and more.

title: JetBlue stepping up campaign to save its plan to buy Spirit Airlines for $3.8 billion
description: JetBlue Airways is making another move to try to save its proposed purchase of Spirit Airlines

title: UK government may ban American XL bully dogs after a child was attacked
description: Britain’s home secretary says she is seeking “urgent advice” on banning a type of American bully dog, highlighting an attack on a 11-year-old girl over the weekend

title: Stellantis reports progress in talks with auto workers, to make another offer Monday
description: Stellantis is reporting progress in talks with the United Auto Workers union with just three days left before contracts expire with Detroit’s three automakers

title: Jamaica police charge man suspected of being a serial killer with 4 counts of murder
description: Police in Jamaica have charged a man they suspect is a serial killer involved in the deaths of at least four people with murder

title: Ian Wilmut, British scientist who led team that cloned Dolly the Sheep, dies at 79
description: The British scientist who led the team that cloned Dolly the Sheep in 1996 has died at age 79

title: Sweden: Man guilty of storing dead partner's body in freezer to cash in pension
description: A Swedish court has sentenced a 57-year-old Norwegian man for fraud and falsifying records for putting his dead partner in a freezer and cashing in her pension

title: Teen arrested after guard shot breaking up fight outside high school football game
description: Police in central New York say a 16-year-old was arrested for shooting a school security guard who was breaking up a fight outside a high school football game

title: Residents mobilize in search of dozens missing after Nigeria boat accident
description: The death toll in the boat accident in north-central Nigeria’s Niger State has risen to 28 and communities have mobilized in support of an intensified search for dozens still missing after the passenger boat capsized

title: India, Saudi Arabia agree to expand economic and security ties after the G20 summit
description: India and Saudi Arabia have agreed to expand trade and security ties, two days after their leaders and others attending a Group of 20 summit announced a new railways and port corridor deal that will link India, Middle East and Europe

title: UN rights chief calls for 'urgent reversal' to civilian rule in African countries
description: The U.N. human rights chief has called for an “urgent reversal” of military takeovers and return to civilian rule in African countries where coups have driven out elected leaders

title: Court sentences former cricketer to 12 years over a bounty for a far-right lawmaker
description: A Dutch court has sentenced a former Pakistan cricketer to 12 years in prison over allegations that he incited people to kill firebrand anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders

title: Kim Jong Un departs Pyongyang en route to Russia, South Korean official says
description: A train "likely" to be carrying North Korean leader Kim Jong Un departed Pyongyang on Monday, a South Korean official told ABC News.

title: Explosion at Archer Daniels Midland facility in Illinois injures employees
description: An explosion at an Archer Daniels Midland facility in Illinois has injured several employees and sent a tower of smoke into the air

title: California school district to pay $2.25M to settle suit involving teacher who had student's baby
description: Teacher became pregnant by one of the students she allegedly sexually abused.

title: Novak Djokovic wins US Open 2023
description: Novak Djokovic won the U.S. Open on Sunday, beating Russian Daniil Medvedev in straight sets.

title: Novak Djokovic wins the US Open for his 24th Grand Slam title by beating Daniil Medvedev
description: He got past Daniil Medvedev 6-3, 7-6 (5), 6-3 in the final at Flushing Meadows.
